==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|伽耶|伽羅 (伽耶)}}
{{wikipedia|Gaya confederacy}}
[[File:Map_of_Gaya_-_han.png|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|伽羅}} (''Kara''): the '''[[w:Gaya confederacy|Gaya confederacy]]''' is shown here in orange.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|か|ら|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|zra|ja|sort=から}} {{m|zra|kara}}.<ref>{{cite-book|author=Christopher I. Beckwith|title=Empires of the Silk Road: A History of Central Eurasia from the Bronze Age to the Present|publisher=Princeton University Press|year=2009|isbn=978-0-691-13589-2|page=105|text=“The spelling Kaya is the modern Korean reading of the characters used to write the name; the pronunciation /kara/ (transcriptionally *kala) is certain.”}}</ref><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanyo|から|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|から}}

# the [[w:Gaya_confederacy|Gaya confederacy]], a grouping of smaller states on the southern end of the Korean peninsula, roughly dating to 42-532 CE
# more broadly, ancient Korea and/or China

=====Usage notes=====
The Gaya confederacy sense is also found spelled {{ja-l|加羅}} and {{ja-l|迦羅}}

The broader sense is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|唐}} (or rarely {{ja-l|漢}}) when referring to China, and {{ja-l|韓}} when referring to the states that became modern Korea.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|Gaya confederacy}} {{ja-r|伽耶|^かや}}, {{ja-r|任那|^みまな}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|沈香|伽羅 (沈香) (aromatic tree)}}
{{wikipedia|Agarwood}}
[[File:Agarwood.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|伽羅}} (''kyara''): '''[[agarwood]]'''.]]
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|イチイ|伽羅 (イチイ) (Japanese yew)}}
{{wikipedia|Taxus cuspidata}}
[[File:Taxus_cuspidata2.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|伽羅}} (''kyara''): the '''Japanese yew'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|きゃ|ら|yomi=on}}
There are two leading theories.
* From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きゃら}} {{m|zh|伽羅|tr=ghia la}}, itself a phonetic rendering of the first two syllables of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=きゃら}} {{m|sa|कालागुरु|tr=kālāguru}}, referring to a kind of fragrant black (''kālā'') [[agarwood]] tree (''aguru'') used for [[incense]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
* From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きゃら}} {{m|zh|伽羅|tr=ghia la}}, itself a phonetic rendering of the last two syllables of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=きゃら}} {{m|sa|तगर|tr=tagara}}, referring to the {{taxlink|Tabernaemontana coronaria|species|noshow=1}} ({{vern|pinwheel flower}} or {{vern|crepe jasmine}}) or a fragrant powder made from the plant.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=go|きゃら|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きゃら}}

# ''[[Taxus cuspidata]]'', the [[Japanese yew]]
# an [[aromatic]] [[tree]]
# [[incense]], especially when made from such aromatic [[wood]]
# {{qualifier|by extension}} something of high quality, a [[rarity]], a [[luxury]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=きゃら|slang|obsolete}} during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], a [[red-light district]] slang word for [[money]]
# [[flattery]], [[sycophancy]]

* {{ja-r|伽羅の木|きゃら の き}}: ''[[Taxus cuspidata]]'', the [[Japanese yew]]
* {{ja-r|伽羅の字|きゃら の じ}}: in the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]], a [[red-light district]] slang term for [[money]], especially the fee paid to an [[entertainer]] or [[prostitute]]
* {{ja-r|伽羅の枕|きゃら の まくら}}: a [[wooden]] [[headrest]] with a [[drawer]] for burning [[incense]]

* {{ja-r|伽羅木|きゃらぼく}}: ''[[Taxus cuspidata]]'', the [[Japanese yew]]
* {{ja-r|伽羅枕|きゃら まくら}}: a [[wooden]] [[headrest]] with a [[drawer]] for burning [[incense]]
* {{ja-r|伽羅女|きゃら め}}: {{qualifier|slang}} a [[beautiful]] [[woman]]

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|伽羅で作った仏同然|きゃら で つくった ほとけ どうぜん}}: “just like a Buddha statue made from agarwood” → [[agarwood]] only smells nice when burned, so making a statue out of agarwood is pointless: something or someone of high value, but that turns out to be useless
* {{ja-r|伽羅を言う|きゃら を いう}}: “to speak incense” → to [[flatter]], to say nice things to flatter or [[ingratiate]] someone
* {{ja-r|伽羅の仏に箔置く|きゃら の ほとけ に はく おく}}: “to put gold foil on an agarwood Buddha” → “to put [[the icing on the cake]]”: adding something good on top of something that is already good
* {{ja-r|伽羅も焚かず屁もこかず|きゃら も たかず .へ も こかず}}: “not even burning incense, not even passing gas” → [[neither here nor there]], neither good nor bad
{{der-bottom}}
